answers.1A: If XCl2 then X should be a metal with valency 2 Therefore - (1) Sulphate formula : XSO4 (2) Hydroxide formula : X(OH)2
answers.1B: XN2 is nitride X is a valency 3 metal as nitrogen has valency 3 Therefore Sulphate's formula would be X2(SO4)3 and Hydroxide formula would be X(OH)3
answers.1C: valency of Nitrogen in 1) NO : +2 2) N2O : +1 3) NO2 : +4 3) NO2 : +4
answers.2B: The eight metals showing variable valency 1) Iron (Fe) : +2,+3 2) copper (Cu) :+1,+2 3) Mercury (Hg) : +1,+2 4) Tin (Sn) : +2,+4 5) Lead (Pb) : +2,+4 6) Gold (Au) : +1,+3 7) Chromium (Cr) : +2,+3,+4,+6 8) Manganese (Mn) : +2,+3,+4,+6,+7
answers.2C: Examples of Chemical Equations : ## Page 2 **(a)** - * One product: 2H2 + O2 \(\rightleftharpoons\) 2H2O - **(b)** - * Two products: CaCO3 \(\rightarrow\) CaO + CO2 + \(\Delta\) - **(c)** - * Three products: 4HNO3 \(\rightarrow\) 2H2O + 4NO2 + O2 - **(d)** - * Four products: 2KClO3 \(\rightarrow\) 2KCl + 3O2 + \(\Delta\) Answer: 2D
